sub_topic: Calculation of thermodynamic properties of molecules and reactions.
message_1:
What is the Gibbs free energy change (ΔG) at 298 K for the reaction of methane (CH4) and oxygen (O2) gas to form carbon dioxide (CO2) and water (H2O) vapor according to the following balanced equation at standard conditions: 

CH4(g) + 2O2(g) -> CO2(g) + 2H2O(g) 

You are given the enthalpy of formation (ΔH°f) and the standard entropy (S°) for each substance involved in the reaction. Also, assume ideal gas behavior for all gases involved.
message_2: To calculate the Gibbs free energy change (ΔG) for the reaction, we need the given enthalpy of formation (ΔH°f) and the standard entropy (S°) values for each substance involved in the reaction. Please provide these values.
